page.title: 05 Otley Hall
page.content: Otley Hall is a large building surrounded by a moat. There is evidence of pargetted plaster and the half timbered and brick-studded building is crowned by high roofs and towering chimneys. It was the Gosnold family home from 1440-1674. They were typical Renaissance landed gentry and gentlemen adventurers, hard-headed justices and squires whose sons voyaged to the New World, waited upon the King at court or served their county in the Commons, year after year amassing lands, silver, jewels, money and prestige, marrying into the East-Anglian nobility, Bacons, Wingfields and Tollemaches, and occupying estates in all parts of Suffolk. Within the Gosnold family Bartholomew Gosnold is especially interesting(see Godspeed)
